intro: Timonius schumannii, commonly known as the Schumann's timonius, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of red and yellow. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
